intro: Cyathocalyx acuminatus, commonly known as the sharp-cupped bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant produces small, green, cup-like structures called cyathia, which house the tiny flowers. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
